alert.note: Alert for Albany; Greene; Schenectady; Schoharie; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:49AM EST until January 14 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Ulster County in east central New York... Southwestern Schenectady County in east central New York... Western Albany County in east central New York... Southwestern Greene County in east central New York... Schoharie County in east central New York... * Until 1245 PM EST. * At 1149 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Sharon Springs to near Harvard, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Berne, Middleburgh, Gilboa, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Prattsville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Breakabeen, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Central Bridge, Preston-Potter Hollow, Knox, Carlisle, Sharon, and Seward. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
